content.question: NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION. Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit. Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point. Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number. A particle moves along the <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis so that its position at time <math alttext="t is greater than 0 "><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> is given by <math alttext="x of t equals, the fraction with numerator t squared, minus 9, and denominator 3 times t squared, plus 8, end fraction"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>. (a) Show that the velocity of the particle at time <math alttext="t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is given by <math alttext="v of t equals, the fraction with numerator 70 t, and denominator open parenthesis, 3 times t squared, plus 8, close parenthesis, squared, end fraction"><mstyle><mrow><mi>v</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>70</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>.

frqParts.text: NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION. Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit. Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point. Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number. A particle moves along the <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis so that its position at time <math alttext="t is greater than 0 "><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> is given by <math alttext="x of t equals, the fraction with numerator t squared, minus 9, and denominator 3 times t squared, plus 8, end fraction"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>. (a) Show that the velocity of the particle at time <math alttext="t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is given by <math alttext="v of t equals, the fraction with numerator 70 t, and denominator open parenthesis, 3 times t squared, plus 8, close parenthesis, squared, end fraction"><mstyle><mrow><mi>v</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>70</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(b) Is the particle moving toward the origin or away from the origin at time <math alttext="t equals 2 "><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ? Give a reason for your answer.

(c) The acceleration of the particle is given by <math alttext="a, of t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>a</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Write an expression for <math alttext="a, of t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>a</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, and find the value of <math alttext="a, of 2"><mstyle><mrow><mi>a</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.
(d) What position does the particle approach as <math alttext="t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> approaches infinity?

topic.text: 1.15: Connecting Limits at Infinity and Horizontal Asymptotes

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
